revision.text:
{{Short description|Austrian music and visual art group}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Farmers Manual | image = Farmers_Manual_2002.jpg | caption = Farmers Manual performing at the [[Schirn Kunsthalle Frankfurt|Schirn Kunsthalle]], [[Frankfurt am Main|Frankfurt]], February 2002 | image_size = | background = group_or_band | alias = farmersmanual | origin = [[Vienna]], [[Austria]] | genre = [[Experimental music|Experimental]], [[Electronic music|electronic]], extreme computer music | years_active = 1995–present | label = [[Mego (label)|Mego]], [[Tray (label)|Tray]], [[OR (label)|OR]], and more | associated_acts = [[CD Slopper]]
[[Gcttcatt]]
[[pxp]]
[[Martin Ng]]
[[Russell Haswell]] | website = [http://web.fm web.fm] | current_members = [[Mathias Gmachl]]
[[Stefan Possert]]
[[Oswald Berthold]]
[[Gert Brantner]]
[[Nik Gaffney]] | past_members = }} '''Farmers Manual''' is an electronic music and visual art group, founded in [[Vienna]] in the beginning of the 1990s. The core members of the collective are Mathias Gmachl, Stefan Possert, Oswald Berthold, Gert Brantner, and Nik Gaffney. Part of the very lively Viennese electronic music scene of the 1990s, Farmers Manual were successfully crossing the boundaries between electronic music, live visuals, experimental graphics, and web design for Zeta Industries. Their CDs, published through avant-garde labels such as [[Mego (label)|Mego]], [[Tray (label)|Tray]] or [[OR (label)|OR]], often contained multimedia content. Their most significant release{{according to whom|date=December 2011}} might be ''RLA'' (which stands for "Recent Live Archive"), a DVD released on Mego in 2003, which contains the band's extensive backcatalogue of live concert recordings from 1995 to 2003, compressed in MP3 format - totalling 3 days and 20 hours of audio content and released under a [[Copyleft]] licence.{{Citation|last=Buttimer |first=Colin |author-link=Colin Buttimer |title=Farmers Manual - RLA (recent live archive) DVD |publisher=[[BBC]] |date=2003-06-05 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/music/release/zcf9/ |access-date=2007-12-26 |format=– [https://scholar.google.co.uk/scholar?hl=en&lr=&q=author%3AButtimer+intitle%3AFarmers+Manual+-+RLA+%28recent+live+archive%29+DVD&as_publication=&as_ylo=2003&as_yhi=2003&btnG=Search Scholar search] |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090126180620/http://www.bbc.co.uk/music/release/zcf9/ |archive-date=January 26, 2009 }} As visual artists, Farmers Manual have been included in numerous international festivals, such as [[Festival du nouveau cinéma|FCMM]] (Montreal, 1999), Avanto (Helsinki, 2001), Art+Communication (Riga, 2006) [https://web.archive.org/web/20110722164424/http://rixc.lv/06/en/img14.html]. ==Selected discography== * (1995) Farmers Manual: ''Does Not Compute'' (12", Tray) * (1996) Farmers Manual: ''[[No Backup]]'' (CD+, [[Mego (label)|Mego]] 008) * (1996) Farmers Manual: ''FM'' (12", [[Mego (label)|Mego]] 017) * (1997) Farmers Manual: ''[[fsck (album)|fsck]]'' (CD, Tray) * (1998) Farmers Manual: ''[[Explorers We (album)|Explorers_We]]'' (CD, OR) * (2000) CD_Slopper: ''SaskieWoxi'' (CD, OR) * (2001) Gcttcatt: ''Amperase'' (CD+, [[Mego (label)|Mego]] 021) * (2002) [[pxp]]: ''while(p){print"."," "x$p++}'' (CD, Wavetrap) Note: this album, by Farmers Manual member Oswald Berthold, was awarded an Honorary Mention at [[Ars Electronica]] 2002.{{Citation|url=http://www.aec.at/en/archives/prix_archive/prixJuryStatement.asp?iProjectID=11720 |title=Prix Ars Electronica 2002 - Jury-Statement |access-date=2007-12-26 |last=Hecker |first=Florian |author-link=Florian Hecker |last2=Herrington |first2=Tony |author2-link=Tony Herrington |last3=Humon |first3=Naut |author3-link=Naut Humon |publisher=Ars Electronica Archive |year=2002 |format=– [https://scholar.google.co.uk/scholar?hl=en&lr=&q=author%3AHecker+intitle%3APrix+Ars+Electronica+2002+-+Jury-Statement&as_publication=&as_ylo=2002&as_yhi=2002&btnG=Search Scholar search] |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060207155518/http://www.aec.at/en/archives/prix_archive/prixJuryStatement.asp?iProjectID=11720 |archive-date=February 7, 2006 }} * (2003) Farmers Manual: ''RLA'' (DVD-Video/ROM, [[Mego (label)|Mego]] 777) * (2017) Farmers Manual: ''fmoto'' (Files, [https://farmersmanual.bandcamp.com/album/fmoto bandcamp]) ==References== ==Further reading== * {{Citation | url = http://www.heise.de/tp/r4/artikel/3/3245/1.html | title = Farmers Manual- Die digitale Boyz Band | accessdate = 2008-01-01 | last = Medosch | first = Armin | author-link = Armin Medosch | publisher = [[Telepolis]] | date = June 4, 1998 }} ==External links== *[http://web.fm/ Farmers Manual website] *Farmers Manual's [http://rla.web.fm/ Recent Live Archive] of live recordings and associated paraphernalia. *[https://farmersmanual.bandcamp.com Farmers Manual catalogue] on [[bandcamp.com]] *[http://www.discogs.com/artist/Farmers+Manual Farmers Manual discography] on [[discogs.com]] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20071013015051/http://mego.at/farmers.html Farmers Manual biography] on mego.at *[https://archive.org/search.php?query=subject%3A%22farmersmanual%22 Recent Live Archive (and various other)] on [[archive.org]] {{Authority control}} [[Category:Free improvisation]] [[Category:Electroacoustic improvisation]] [[Category:Experimental musical groups]] {{electronic-band-stub}}
